catalogue_raissonne: Hagiwara Hideo hanga sakuhin mokuroku 2013, no. 216
creditline: Gift of Sue Y.S. Kimm and Seymour Grufferman
description: abstract; black/dark blue at top with scrolls; grey at bottom with red, yellow, blue, white wavy lines; black on verso
inscription: bottom center, in pencil:  石の花（青灰） Stone flower: Blue grey | LRC, in pencil: 23/30
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Stone Flower (Ishi no hana 石の花)
text: In 1960 Hagiwara began with the ‘Stone Flower’ series and in most of the prints emphasized one or two colors that he then addressed in the print title, in this case blue and grey. “Thinking about eternal life I gave it the series the title ‘Stone Flower.’ A living flower has a short lifespan, but a stone took thousands and thousands of years to be created.”
title: Stone Flower: Blue, Grey
